publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-1221 Margaret Smith: Identity Cards-That the Parliament notes the Partnership Agreement commitment to evaluate the local pilot projects in order to assess the desirability of creating a national voluntary citizen's entitlement card for appropriate public services, taking care to protect individual privacy; welcomes previous commitments by the Scottish Executive and Her Majesty's Government that identity cards will not be compulsory for accessing devolved services; supports measures that will genuinely help reduce the threat of terrorism and tackle crime and benefit fraud; believes that it is not proven that identity cards will achieve this, and calls on the Executive not to give Scottish police officers the legal right to demand proof of identity without cause. Supported by: George Lyon*, Jeremy Purvis*, Donald Gorrie*, Mike Rumbles*, John Farquhar Munro*, Mark Ballard*, Iain Smith*, Dr Jean Turner*, Chris Ballance*, Robert Brown*, Mike Pringle*, Mr Jamie Stone*

Supported by: George Lyon, Jeremy Purvis, Donald Gorrie, Mike Rumbles, John Farquhar Munro, Mark Ballard, Iain Smith, Dr Jean Turner, Chris Ballance, Robert Brown, Mike Pringle, Mr Jamie Stone
S2M-1221 Identity Cards (lodged on 28 April 2004) Nora Radcliffe*
